pddl4j.exp
Class OrExp

java.lang.Object
  pddl4j.exp.AbstractExp
      pddl4j.exp.ListExp
          pddl4j.exp.OrExp
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Exp>, Exp
public final class OrExp
extends ListExp

This generic class is implemented by all disjunctive PDDL expression.

See Also:
Serialized Form

          Creates a new empty disjunctive expression.

          Creates a new list expression with a specific id and expressions.

Method Detail

apply

public OrExp apply(Substitution sigma)
Substitutes all occurrences of the variables that occur in this expression and that are mapped in the substitution by its binding expression.

Specified by:
apply in interface Exp
Overrides:
apply in class ListExp
Parameters:
sigma - the substitution.
Returns:
a substituted copy of this expression.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if sigma == null.

standardize

public OrExp standardize()
Standardizes all occurrences of the variables that occur in this expression. Remember that free variables are existentially quantified.

Specified by:
standardize in interface Exp
Overrides:
standardize in class ListExp
Returns:
this expression.
See Also:
Exp.standardize()

standardize

public OrExp standardize(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> images)
Standardizes all occurrences of the variables that occur in this expression. The map argument is used to store the variable already standardized. The bound argument is used to store the bound variables. Remember that free variables are existentially quantified.

Specified by:
standardize in interface Exp
Overrides:
standardize in class ListExp
Parameters:
images - the object that maps old variable images to the standardize image.
Returns:
this expression.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if images == null || bound == null.
See Also:
Exp.standardize(Map)
